content: You know, normally I would not make that big of a deal about some radical Islamic terrorist getting captured in Iraq. But, this one is just too good to pass up. You see, if you keep up with the times as I do, you would know that they captured this man already on March 9, 2007. But, then they said, "no, we were wrong. It isn't him". Ok, no big deal, right? Ah, but the plot thickens. On May 3, 2007, Iraqi Interior Ministry said that al-Baghdadi was killed by American and Iraqi forces. Ok, maybe now we get some closure. Nope! Two months later in July, the Pentagon tells us that al-Baghdadi never actually existed. That he was a fictional character all along. Now, I must tell you that I thought that was crazy at the time. I said to myself, "why in the hell are they just making up terrorists now"? Who knows why? But, I chalked it up as the government just screwing with our heads as they usually like to do to keep us in order. Oh well, that is to be expected. Now, I came home and check the daily news updates only to find that Mr. al-Baghdadi has made it into the news again. And, wouldn't you know it, they are saying that they have captured him!!! Here is the story (and, there are many more like it) claiming we have captured al-Baghdadi: ---http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/world/iraq/article6155579.ece
